quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
author: Plato

quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

quote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination.
author: Plato

quote: Man—a being in search of meaning.
author: Plato

quote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
author: Plato

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato

quote: Never discourage anyone... who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.
author: Plato

quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
author: Plato

quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
author: Plato

quote: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.
author: Plato

quote: An empty vessel makes the loudest sound; those that have the least wit are the greatest babblers.
author: Plato

quote: Love is the name for our pursuit of wholeness, for our desire to be complete.
author: Plato

quote: Thinking is the talking of the soul with itself.
author: Plato

quote: Ignorance, the root and stem of every evil.
author: Plato

quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
author: Plato

quote: A library of wisdom is more precious than all wealth...
author: Plato

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
author: Plato

quote: All men are by nature equal, made all of the same earth by one workman.
author: Plato

quote: Books give a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and life to everything.
author: Plato

quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato

quote: We are twice armed if we fight with faith.
author: Plato

quote: No one is a friend to his friend who does not love in return.
author: Plato

quote: There is no harm in repeating a good thing.
author: Plato

quote: He who commits injustice is ever made more wretched than he who suffers it.
author: Plato

quote: Honesty is for the most part less profitable than dishonesty.
author: Plato

quote: Poetry is nearer to vital truth than history.
author: Plato

quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
author: Plato

quote: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.
author: Plato

quote: The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.
author: Plato

quote: When the mind is thinking it is talking to itself.
author: Plato

quote: Dictatorship naturally arises out of democracy, and the most aggravated form of tyranny and slavery from liberty.
author: Plato

quote: Those who are able to see beyond the shadows and lies of their culture will never be understood, let alone believed, by the masses.
author: Plato

quote: Never discourage anyone... who continually makes progress, no matter how slow—even if that someone is yourself!
author: Plato

quote: Even if that someone is yourself!
author: Plato

quote: Just as bees make honey from thyme, the strongest and driest of herbs, so do the wise profit from the most difficult of experiences.
author: Plato

quote: Steady as she goes; none of this madness!
author: Plato

quote: Ideals are like stars—they are not to be reached, but are to guide you.
author: Plato

quote: Reality is created by the mind, we can change our reality by changing our mind.
author: Plato
